title: Print, "Ciboire (Ciborium), plate 80, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1695–1750
signed: Signed in plate, lower left: J. A. Meissonnier inv.; lower right: Huquier Sculp. et ex. rue Jacqu, CPR.
inscribed: Inscribed in plate, upper left: N; upper right 80; lower center: Ciboire
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Container on platform with an escutcheon depicting Crucifixion; two putti put arms around stem of container; central body of stem made up of two putti heads surrounded by feathery foliage, leading up to the cup that depicts a scene of the last supper, framed in rococo style and flanked by two angels. Lid has wheat, grapevines and is topped with two putti heads gazing up at a cross.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Ciboire (Ciborium), plate 80, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1695–1750.
1695–1750. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-212-38.
